    title: "Fixed Effects & Instrumental Variables"
    categories: [causal-inference, panel-data]

    <div class="topic-meta">Updated: {{< meta date format='YYYY-MM-DD' >}}</div>


**Fixed Effects (FE).** Control for time-invariant unobserved heterogeneity by including unit/time effects (e.g., entity and/or time dummies).

**Instrumental Variables (IV).** Address endogeneity by using an instrument \(Z\) correlated with endogenous regressor \(X\) but affecting \(Y\) *only* through \(X\).

**When to use.**
- FE: panel data with omitted, time-invariant confounders.
- IV: simultaneity, measurement error, or omitted variable bias.

**Diagnostics.**
- Check instrument relevance (first-stage F-stat).
- Overidentification tests (when multiple instruments).
